features.description: Database migration creates high_scores table with correct schema
test_steps: Run: php artisan migrate
Verify high_scores table exists (artisan test)
Verify id column exists as bigint primary key (artisan test)
Verify name column exists as varchar(100) (artisan test)
Verify turns column exists as integer (artisan test)
Verify difficulty column exists as varchar(10) (artisan test)
Verify created_at and updated_at timestamp columns exist (artisan test)

features.description: HighScore model has correct fillable fields and validation
test_steps: Verify HighScore model exists in app/Models (artisan test)
Verify fillable fields include name, turns, difficulty (artisan test)
Verify model can be created with valid data (artisan test)
Verify validation rejects empty name (artisan test)
Verify validation rejects negative turns (artisan test)
Verify validation rejects invalid difficulty values (artisan test)

features.description: Home page route displays game board correctly
test_steps: Start Laravel server with: php artisan serve --host=0.0.0.0
Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Verify page loads with 200 status code
Verify page title contains 'Vier op een Rij' or 'Connect Four'
Verify 7x6 game board grid is visible
Verify difficulty selection buttons are visible (EASY, MEDIUM, HARD)
Take screenshot for verification

features.description: Difficulty selection initializes game with correct settings
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Click on EASY difficulty button
Verify game board becomes interactive
Verify current turn indicator shows 'Player' or 'Your Turn'
Click on MEDIUM difficulty button (after reset)
Verify game initializes correctly
Click on HARD difficulty button (after reset)
Verify game initializes correctly
Take screenshot showing difficulty selection UI

features.description: Player can click column to drop red disc with visual feedback
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select EASY difficulty
Hover over first column and verify visual feedback (highlight or cursor change)
Click on first column
Verify red disc appears in bottom row of first column
Verify disc drop animation plays smoothly
Click on same column again
Verify second red disc stacks above first disc
Take screenshot showing player discs

features.description: AI responds with yellow disc after player move
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select EASY difficulty
Click on column 3 to drop player disc
Wait for AI response (1-2 seconds delay)
Verify yellow disc appears in one of the columns
Verify turn indicator switches back to player
Make another player move
Verify AI responds again with yellow disc
Take screenshot showing both player and AI discs

features.description: Game detects horizontal win condition correctly
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select EASY difficulty
Using Playwright, simulate game moves to create horizontal win for player
Drop player discs in columns 0, 1, 2, 3 (bottom row)
Verify winning discs are highlighted or marked
Verify win message displays 'You Win!' or similar
Verify game board becomes non-interactive after win
Verify high score submission form appears
Take screenshot showing win state

features.description: Game detects vertical win condition correctly
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select EASY difficulty
Using Playwright, simulate game moves to create vertical win
Drop player discs in same column 4 times (with AI moves in other columns)
Verify winning discs are highlighted vertically
Verify win message appears
Verify high score form is shown
Take screenshot showing vertical win

features.description: Game detects diagonal win conditions (both directions)
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select EASY difficulty
Simulate diagonal win (ascending: bottom-left to top-right)
Verify diagonal win is detected and highlighted
Take screenshot of ascending diagonal win
Reset game and select EASY again
Simulate diagonal win (descending: top-left to bottom-right)
Verify diagonal win is detected and highlighted
Take screenshot of descending diagonal win

features.description: Game detects and handles draw condition when board fills up
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select EASY difficulty
Simulate moves that fill the entire board without winning
Verify draw message displays when board is full
Verify game board becomes non-interactive
Verify high score form does NOT appear (only wins are recorded)
Verify 'New Game' or 'Reset' button is available
Take screenshot showing draw state

features.description: AI difficulty EASY plays suboptimally (66% optimal, 33% random)
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select EASY difficulty
Set up a situation where AI could block player's winning move
Make multiple games to observe AI behavior
Verify AI sometimes makes non-optimal moves (doesn't block obvious wins)
Take screenshot showing AI's suboptimal play
Note: Full statistical validation would require multiple games

features.description: AI difficulty HARD plays optimally using minimax algorithm
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select HARD difficulty
Set up a situation where player has 3 in a row
Verify AI blocks the winning move in the 4th position
Set up situation where AI has 3 in a row
Verify AI completes its own winning move
Verify AI makes strategically sound moves throughout game
Take screenshot showing AI's optimal blocking behavior

features.description: High score submission form appears only on player win
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select EASY difficulty
Simulate a player win
Verify high score form appears with name input field
Verify form shows the number of turns taken
Verify form shows the difficulty level
Verify form has a submit button
Take screenshot of high score submission form

features.description: POST /scores endpoint saves high score to database
test_steps: Verify POST /scores route exists (artisan test)
Submit high score with name='TestPlayer', turns=15, difficulty='EASY' (artisan test)
Verify record is created in high_scores table (artisan test)
Verify created_at timestamp is set (artisan test)
Verify POST returns redirect to /scores or success response (artisan test)
Verify validation rejects empty name (artisan test)
Verify validation rejects turns < 4 (minimum possible) (artisan test)

features.description: GET /scores displays high scores sorted by fewest turns
test_steps: Seed database with 5 sample high scores with different turn counts (artisan test)
Navigate to http://localhost:8000/scores
Verify page displays high scores table
Verify columns include Rank, Name, Turns, Difficulty, Date
Verify scores are sorted by turns ascending (lowest first)
Verify rank numbers are displayed (1, 2, 3, etc.)
Take screenshot of high scores page

features.description: High scores page can filter by difficulty level
test_steps: Seed database with scores for EASY, MEDIUM, and HARD difficulties (artisan test)
Navigate to http://localhost:8000/scores
Verify filter dropdown or buttons for difficulty are present
Click on EASY filter
Verify only EASY difficulty scores are displayed
Click on HARD filter
Verify only HARD difficulty scores are displayed
Click on 'All' or reset filter
Verify all scores are displayed again
Take screenshot showing filtered results

features.description: Tab navigation between Game and High Scores works correctly
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Verify 'Game' and 'High Scores' navigation tabs/links are visible
Verify 'Game' tab is active/highlighted on home page
Click on 'High Scores' tab
Verify navigation to /scores page
Verify 'High Scores' tab is now active/highlighted
Click on 'Game' tab
Verify navigation back to home page
Verify 'Game' tab is active again
Take screenshot showing tab navigation

features.description: Reset/New Game button reinitializes game state
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Select MEDIUM difficulty
Make several moves (fill some columns partially)
Click 'New Game' or 'Reset' button
Verify game board is cleared (all discs removed)
Verify difficulty selection reappears or current difficulty is maintained
Verify turn counter is reset to 0
Make a move to verify game is functional after reset
Take screenshot showing reset game board

features.description: Responsive design works on mobile viewport
test_steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Resize browser to mobile viewport (375x667)
Verify game board scales appropriately and is fully visible
Verify difficulty buttons are accessible and properly sized
Verify columns are still clickable on small screen
Navigate to /scores page
Verify high scores table is responsive (scrollable or stacked)
Take screenshot of mobile game view
Take screenshot of mobile high scores view

features.description: Complete end-to-end game flow from start to high score submission
test_steps: Start Laravel server with: php artisan serve --host=0.0.0.0
Navigate to http://localhost:8000/
Take screenshot of initial state
Select EASY difficulty
Play a complete game and win (using Playwright to automate moves)
Verify win message appears
Enter name 'E2E Test Player' in high score form
Submit high score form
Verify redirect to /scores page
Verify new score appears in high scores list
Verify score data is correct (name, turns, difficulty, date)
Take screenshot of final high scores page with new entry
Query database to confirm record exists (artisan test)
